ISKCON Temple13.Kailasagiri14.Kali TempleConclusionJoin our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Welcome to a spiritual journey through the temples in Visakhapatnam, a city where divinity and serenity seamlessly blend. Nestled along the serene coastlines and picturesque hills, Visakhapatnam is home to some of the most revered and famous temples in Visakhapatnam. These sacred sites not only offer a sanctuary for the soul but also reflect the rich cultural heritage of the region, making them one of the must-visit places in Vishakhapatnam.Whether you’re a devotee seeking divine blessings or a traveler yearning for spiritual solace, the temples in Visakhapatnam provide a captivating glimpse into the timeless traditions and profound spirituality that define this beautiful city. Join us as we explore these holy sanctuaries, each with its own unique history and divine presence.Let’s Explore the Best Temples in Visakhapatnam: A Spiritual Journey1.Varaha Lakshmi NarasimhaImage source – Tripadvisor”The Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Temple in Simhachalam, Visakhapatnam, is a renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu in his Varaha Narasimha avatar. Situated atop the Simhachalam hill range, 300 metres above sea level, the temple is celebrated for its impressive Kalinga-Dravidian architecture, featuring intricate stone carvings and sculptures. As one of the famous temples in Visakhapatnam, it attracts numerous pilgrims and tourists.Tracing its origins to the 13th century, the Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Temple was built by the Eastern Ganga king Narasingha Deva I and consecrated by his son Bhanudeva I in 1268 CE. This historic temple has been a significant site of pilgrimage and literary inspiration, with many devotional works composed in its praise. The rich Visakhapatnam temple history is deeply intertwined with the cultural heritage of the region, making it a key attraction for history enthusiasts.The temple’s main deity, Varaha Narasimha, is believed to have manifested here to protect his devotee Prahlada. The Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Temple hosts several important festivals throughout the year, including the Chandanotsavam, when the deity’s sandalwood covering is removed. As one of the most visited temples in Visakhapatnam, it continues to be a prominent spiritual and cultural landmark. Thus, seeking blessings of Lord Narsimha here is one of the best things to do in Vishakhapatanam.Timings: 4:00 AM to 9:00 PM Address: Simhachalam Road, Simhachalam, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, 5300282.Kanaka MahaLakshmi TempleImage source – Tripadvisor”The Kanaka MahaLakshmi Temple is a significant Hindu temple located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, India. Dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi, the consort of Lord Vishnu, the temple is known for its beautiful architecture and serves as a popular pilgrimage site. Among the temples in Visakhapatnam, it stands out for its historical significance and devotion.The temple’s history dates back to the 13th century, with the present structure built by the Eastern Ganga king Narasingha Deva I in 1268 CE. It is famous for its intricate carvings and sculptures, showcasing the craftsmanship of the artisans of that era. The Kanaka MahaLakshmi Temple is a must-visit in the Visakhapatnam temple list, reflecting the region’s rich cultural and religious heritage.Managed by the Simhachalam Devasthanam Board, the temple is also known for its vibrant festivals, including the Dola Utsava, Kalyanotsava, Chandanotsava, Narasimha Jayanti, and Navaratrotsava. For those planning a visit, checking the Visakhapatnam temple timings is essential to participate in these celebrations and experience the spiritual atmosphere.Timings: Open 24 hoursAddress: Town Kotha Road, Burujupeta, Chengal Rao Peta, Port Area, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, 530001Also Read: Shopping In Visakhapatnam: Know The 13 Best Shopping Places3.Sampath Vinayagar TempleImage source – Hindus Temple Guide”The Sampath Vinayagar Temple in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha. Built in 1962 by T.S. Rajeshwaran and T.S. Selvaganesan, the temple has become a significant cultural and religious landmark in the city. Among the best temples to visit in Visakhapatnam, it stands out for its historical and spiritual importance.The temple gained prominence in 1971 when Admiral Krishnan broke 1001 coconuts before the presiding deity, Lord Ganesh, as a gesture of gratitude for saving the city from the Pakistani attack by sinking the PNS Ghazi submarine. Known for its daily deep aradhana and special pujas, the Sampath Vinayagar Temple is believed to bring good fortune and blessings to devotees. This makes it one of the famous temples in Visakhapatnam.Situated in the busy Asilmetta area, the temple is also popular for its unique customs, such as the ritual of performing puja for newly purchased vehicles. As one of the most visited temples in Visakhapatnam, the Sampath Vinayagar Temple is a must-visit destination for those seeking spiritual fulfilment and cultural experiences in the city.Timings: Open 24 hoursAddress: 10-1-33 Waltair Appliance, road, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 5300034.Kala Bhairava TempleImage source – X.com”The Kala Bhairava Temple is a significant Hindu temple located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. According to legend, it was constructed by the rulers of ancient Kalinga, the Choda Gangas, who were known for building many Shaivite temples in the region. Dedicated to the fierce manifestation of Lord Shiva, known as Kala Bhairava, the temple stands as a testament to the region’s rich religious heritage.Situated in the Simhachalam area along the Simhachalam Sontyam Road, the Kala Bhairava Temple is renowned for its unique architectural style and intricate carvings, reflecting the craftsmanship of the artisans who built it centuries ago. As one of the notable temples near Visakhapatnam, it showcases the historical and cultural significance of the area. Despite reports of poor maintenance and neglect in recent times, the temple continues to attract devotees and visitors from across the region.The Kala Bhairava Temple remains an important cultural and religious landmark among the temples in Visakhapatnam. Its rich history and architectural beauty make it a key destination for those interested in religious temples in Visakhapatnam. While the temple faces challenges in upkeep, its spiritual significance endures, drawing pilgrims and history enthusiasts alike.Timings: 7:00 AM to 7:00 PMAddress: Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 531173Also Read: 12 Best Places To Eat In Visakhapatnam | Must-Try For Foodies5.Sai Baba TempleThe Sai Baba Temple in Visakhapatnam, also known as the Sri Shirdi Sai Mandir, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to the spiritual leader Shri Sai Baba of Shirdi. Located in Chinna Waltair, the temple is situated on the first floor of a complex that houses various deities from Southern India, including Ganapati, Shiva, Parvati, Dattatreya, Rama, Hanuman, and others. Among the temples in Visakhapatnam, it stands out for its devotion and spiritual ambiance.Established on 9th February 1977 with a Bhoomi Pooja ceremony, the Sai Baba Temple has been a significant place of worship since 18th March 1993 when devotees began organising prayer meetings and worshipping a 5.5 feet tall idol of Sri Sai Baba. The temple is open from 5:15 AM to 8:30 PM, with special aartis performed during opening and closing hours. This makes it a key entry in the Visakhapatnam temple list for those seeking spiritual fulfilment.The temple complex includes a function hall on the ground floor, used for various events and ceremonies, enhancing its role as a community centre. As one of the famous temples in Visakhapatnam, the Sai Baba Temple continues to attract devotees seeking solace and spiritual guidance, making it an essential destination for both residents and visitors.Timings: 5:15 AM to 8:30 PMAddress: East Point Colony, Chinna Waltair, Pedda Waltair, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 5300176.Sri Venkateswara Swamy TempleImage source – Vizag Tourisms”The Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple, also known as the Rushikonda Venkanna Temple, is a prominent Hindu temple located atop the Rushikonda hill in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. This recently constructed temple, built by the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) at a cost of Rs 28 crore, spans over 10 acres. It was inaugurated in March 2022 after a grand Maha Kumbhabhishekam ceremony. As one of the famous temples in Visakhapatnam, it offers a picturesque view of the nearby beach and harbour, attracting both devotees and tourists.The temple’s architecture follows the Vaikhanasa Agama tradition, featuring a striking pyramid-shaped entrance gopuram. Open from 5 AM to 7 PM daily, except Sundays, the Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple is a significant addition to the temples in Visakhapatnam. Its unique design and serene location make it a must-visit destination for those exploring the spiritual heritage of the region.Situated near other religious sites like the Ross Hill Church and Baba Ishq Madina Mosque, the temple enhances the diverse spiritual landscape of Visakhapatnam. As one of the notable temples near Visakhapatnam, it provides visitors with a rich cultural and religious experience, reflecting the city’s harmonious blend of different faiths.Timings: 6:00 AM to 12:30 PM, 4:00 PM to 9:00 PMAddress: Beach Road, Port Are, Near Post Office, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 5300017.Brahmalingeshwara TempleThe Brahmalingeshwara Temple, located in Balighattam about 3 km southwest of Narsipatnam, is a famous temple in Visakhapatnam that attracts numerous devotees throughout the year. According to legend, the temple was constructed by the Chola kings and is believed to have been built by the gods themselves. As one of the religious temples in Visakhapatnam, it holds great historical and spiritual significance.Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the temple is known for housing the Brahma Lingam, a sacred Shiva Lingam believed to have been consecrated by Lord Brahma himself. It is said that this was the spot where Lord Shiva was pleased with the penance of King Bali, hence the temple’s name. The temple is also famous for the holy Varahi River, which flows from north to south for a short distance near the temple. This makes it a notable entry in the Visakhapatnam temple list.The Brahmalingeshwara Temple celebrates the Shivaratri festival grandly every year, drawing large crowds of devotees. Despite its historical significance, the temple has undergone renovation in recent times to restore its old-world charm and spiritual essence. As one of the significant temples in Visakhapatnam, it continues to be a revered site for those seeking spiritual fulfilment and connection to the region’s rich cultural heritage.Timings: 4:00 AM to 9:00 PMAddress: Balighattam, Visakhapatnam8.Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi TempleImage source – Tripadvisor”The Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple is a revered Hindu temple located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi, the consort of Lord Vishnu, the temple’s history dates back to 1912 when the idol of the presiding deity was discovered in a well near the fort of the then rulers. Among the temples in Visakhapatnam, it is particularly known for its unique feature of having no roof, believed to be the wish of the deity herself.Devotees at the Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple can perform puja and abhishekam themselves without any assistance, adding to its appeal and accessibility. The temple is open from 5 AM to 9 PM daily, with various pujas and sevas offered throughout the week. It has also received the ISO 9001:2015 certification for its quality standards in maintenance, highlighting its commitment to providing a clean and orderly environment for worshipers. This makes it a noteworthy entry among temples in Visakhapatnam.As a significant spiritual and cultural landmark in Visakhapatnam, the Sri Kanaka Mahalakshmi Temple attracts devotees from all walks of life seeking the blessings of the all-giving and accessible Goddess. Its rich history, unique architectural features, and dedication to high maintenance standards make it one of the most important temples in Visakhapatnam for both residents and visitors.Timings: Open 24 hoursAddress: Kanaka MahaLaxmi Temple, Burujupeta, Chengal Rao Peta, Port Area, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 5300019.Ashta Lakshmi TempleImage source – Vizag Tourisms”The Ashta Lakshmi Temple is a prominent Hindu temple located in Kommadi, Visakhapatnam. Dedicated to the eight manifestations of the Hindu goddess Lakshmi, known as the Ashta Lakshmi, the temple is celebrated for its beautiful architecture and intricate carvings. Among the temples in Visakhapatnam, it attracts a large number of devotees throughout the year who come to seek the blessings of the Ashta Lakshmi.Open from 5 AM to 9 PM daily, the Ashta Lakshmi Temple hosts various puja rituals and ceremonies regularly. This makes it a significant spiritual destination and one of the best temples in Visakhapatnam. The temple’s serene atmosphere and devotion-filled environment offer a peaceful retreat for worshippers and tourists alike.Besides being a major religious site, the Ashta Lakshmi Temple is also a popular tourist attraction in Visakhapatnam. Visitors admire its architectural grandeur and the serene atmosphere. The temple has received positive reviews from visitors, with many praising its cleanliness and the warm hospitality of the temple staff. This further solidifies its status as one of the best temples in Visakhapatnam.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 9:00 PMAddress: Kommadi Rd, Revallapalem, Bakkannapalem, Madhurawada, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 53004110.Somalingeshwara Swamy TempleImage source – The Hans India”The Somalingeshwara Swamy Temple is a significant Hindu temple located in Appikonda, Visakhapatnam. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, the temple is renowned for its beautiful architecture and intricate carvings. Its history dates back to the 16th century, with the present structure built by the rulers of the Vijayanagar Empire. Among the best temples to visit in Visakhapatnam, it attracts devotees from across the region.As a popular pilgrimage site, the Somalingeshwara Swamy Temple hosts several important festivals throughout the year, including Maha Shivaratri and Panchuka Puja. These festivals draw large crowds, enhancing the temple’s spiritual and cultural significance. Despite its historical importance, the temple has faced some neglect in recent times, with reports of poor maintenance and lack of proper upkeep.However, efforts are being made by local authorities to restore and preserve this important cultural and religious landmark. The Somalingeshwara Swamy Temple continues to be one of the notable temples in Visakhapatnam, offering a place of worship and heritage for both locals and visitors. Its enduring legacy and ongoing restoration efforts make it a must-visit for those exploring the spiritual sites of Visakhapatnam.Timings: 7:00 AM – 4:00 PM, 6:00 PM – 9:00 PMAddress: Bangarammapalem, Visakhapatnam11.Ramadri TempleThe Ramadri Temple is a significant Hindu temple located in Bheemili, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. The temple is renowned for its 40 feet tall statue of Lord Hanuman, which is the major highlight of the temple. The white statue, adorned with intricate carvings, stands majestically on the Bheemili Beach road, offering impressive views of the Bay of Bengal from the hill where the statue is situated. Among the best temples in Visakhapatnam, the Ramadri Temple is a must-visit for its breathtaking setting and spiritual ambiance.Managed by the World Teacher Trust, the Ramadri Temple is open daily, providing a serene atmosphere for devotees to worship. The temple complex is surrounded by lush greenery, enhancing its calm environment. This peaceful setting makes it one of the best temples in Visakhapatnam, attracting both locals and tourists who seek spiritual solace and scenic beauty.The Ramadri Temple is not only a popular tourist attraction but also a significant spiritual landmark in Visakhapatnam. Its unique features and serene atmosphere make it stand out among the best temples in Visakhapatnam, drawing visitors from near and far to experience its spiritual and aesthetic offerings.Timings: 6 Am – 9 PmAddress: Bheemili, Visakhapatnam12. ISKCON TempleThe ISKCON Temple in Visakhapatnam, also known as the International Society for Krishna Consciousness Temple, is a prominent spiritual landmark offering a serene environment for devotees and visitors. Situated in Sagar Nagar, the temple complex includes a grand temple, prasadam hall, and ashram, providing comprehensive amenities for spiritual upliftment. Among the temples in Visakhapatnam, the ISKCON Temple stands out for its tranquil ambiance and well-maintained facilities.Easily accessible from Visakhapatnam International Airport and Visakhapatnam Junction, the temple attracts devotees from diverse backgrounds seeking solace and spiritual connection. The temple encourages donations based on individual choice, with no entry fee required. Visitors are advised to dress modestly, book guest rooms in advance for extended stays, and maintain cleanliness within the temple premises. To align with Visakhapatnam temple timings, the ISKCON Temple opens its doors early in the morning, welcoming devotees throughout the day.The ISKCON Temple in Visakhapatnam offers a peaceful retreat for those seeking spiritual enlightenment and a deeper connection with Lord Krishna. As one of the key temples in Visakhapatnam, it provides an ideal setting for meditation, worship, and community activities, making it a cherished destination for both locals and tourists.Timings: 7:30 AM – 12:30 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:30 PMAddress: Beach Road, Hare Krishna Land, Sagar Nagar, Rushikonda, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 53004513.KailasagiriKailasagiri is a renowned hilltop park located in Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh. Sprawling across 380 acres and situated at an elevation of 173 metres, the park offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city and the Bay of Bengal. One of the park’s main attractions is the 40-foot tall statue of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, which gives the park its name. While Kailasagiri is not one of the traditional temples in Visakhapatnam, its religious statues and serene atmosphere make it a spiritually significant spot.Visitors can reach the top of the hill via a ropeway or by road, and enjoy various amenities like a toy train, children’s play area, and horse riding. Kailasagiri is a popular picnic spot and tourist attraction, drawing over 300,000 visitors annually. The park’s lush greenery, floral displays, and calm ambiance offer a unique combination of natural beauty and spiritual resonance, making it a notable destination among temples near Visakhapatnam for those seeking a blend of recreation and spirituality.Recognized as the “Best Tourist Spot” by the Government of Andhra Pradesh, Kailasagiri is a must-visit destination in Visakhapatnam. Its serene environment and religious significance contribute to its reputation as a place of peaceful retreat, complementing the array of religious temples in Visakhapatnam. Whether visiting for its scenic views, recreational activities, or spiritual ambiance, Kailasagiri stands out as a key highlight in the city’s diverse landscape.Timings: 10:00 AM – 8:00 PMAddress: HillTop Rd, Kailasagiri, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 53004314.Kali TempleThe Kali Temple in Visakhapatnam, also known as the Kali Matha Temple, is a prominent Hindu temple dedicated to the worship of Goddess Kali. Located along the RK Beach Road, the temple is a popular tourist attraction and a significant part of Visakhapatnam temple history. Built in 1984, it has since become a landmark on the city’s beach promenade, attracting both locals and visitors.The temple is renowned for its grand celebrations during the Vijayadashami festival, which draws large crowds of devotees. Throughout the year, the temple complex hosts various religious ceremonies and cultural events, making it one of the key temples in Visakhapatnam. The vibrant festivities and the spiritual ambiance of the temple offer a unique cultural experience for all who visit.Visitors can easily access the Kali Temple, as it is well-connected to the city’s transportation network. The temple’s serene atmosphere and the opportunity to seek the blessings of Goddess Kali make it a must-visit destination in Visakhapatnam. Its historical significance and cultural vibrancy contribute greatly to Visakhapatnam temple history and the city’s spiritual landscape.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMAddress: Bus Stop, Beside Kali Mata Temple, near Rk beach, Pandurangapuram, Visakhapatnam, Andhra Pradesh 530003ConclusionIn conclusion, the famous temples in Visakhapatnam offer a rich blend of history, culture, and spirituality. From the revered Kali Temple along RK Beach Road to the serene Kailasagiri hilltop park, each site on the Visakhapatnam temple list provides a unique and enriching experience. Whether you’re seeking divine blessings or simply exploring the city’s spiritual heritage, these temples are must-visit destinations that beautifully reflect the vibrant cultural fabric of Visakhapatnam.Get exclusive travel insights & updates into your inbox!Subscribe *By clicking subscribe you'll receive emails from WanderOn.You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!Shrutika Parab★★★★★24 May 2024“Thank you Team Wanderon for the amazing Ladakh Experience.
